title: Social Media Blackmail

steps.text: I have compromising photos of you from your social media. If you don't send me $500 in Bitcoin within 24 hours, I'll send them to all your contacts and post them online. Don't try to contact police - I'm anonymous.

choices.label: Pay the money to make this go away

steps.feedback: Paying extortionists never makes them go away - it proves you'll pay and encourages more demands.

debrief: EMOTION + URGENCY: Sextortion scams use fear and shame to pressure victims into paying quickly. They often have no actual compromising material. Even if they do, paying doesn't guarantee they'll stop - it usually leads to more demands.

items.question: What should you do if someone tries to blackmail you online?
Why do sextortion scammers demand payment quickly?
options: To prevent you from thinking clearly
